text:
Fulton Street, from Columbia Heights to Court Street, showing at the right the American Hotel, No. 28, and the "Brooklyn Daily Union", No. 31. Also a general view south east from one of the towers of the Brooklyn Bridge- then under construction.

About 1872.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Columbia Heights

text:
Court Street, south from Myrtle Ave. In the foreground, is Myrtle Ave. At the left background, is Borough Hall and the Park. In front of the park running right and left, is Fulton Street, upon which is now an elevated line.

1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) At the intersection of Court and Fulton Streets, showing Brooklyn City Hall (now Borough Hall) and the park. At the left (building with the dome) is the court house on Joralemon Street.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing also the S.W. corner of Myrtle Ave., situated thereon is the Oyster House of Phil. H. Grogan.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, a northerly view, showing Fulton Street at the right. The Brooklyn Safe Deposit Co., is visible at right. The buildings in the triangle (background) still standing in (1929).

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing Fulton Street more fully, prior to the erection of the Fulton Street Elevated Lines.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1) At the intersection of Court and Fulton Streets, showing Brooklyn City Hall (now Borough Hall) and the park. At the left (building with the dome) is the court house on Joralemon Street.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing also the S.W. corner of Myrtle Ave., situated thereon is the Oyster House of Phil. H. Grogan.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing Fulton Street more fully, prior to the erection of the Fulton Street Elevated Lines.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing Fulton Street more fully, prior to the erection of the Fulton Street Elevated Lines.

About 1876.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Fulton Street ("El" thereon), south from its intersection with Court Street, past Joralemon Street, showing the Brooklyn Borough Hall (right) facing a small park. Note the absence of the clock tower atop the Borough Hall; it was destroyed by fire.

About 1900

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(2)

The Borough Hall, many years later. The clock tower has been restored.

1936

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project

Fulton Street ("El" thereon), south from its intersection with Court Street, past Joralemon Street, showing the Brooklyn Borough Hall (right) facing a small park. Note the absence of the clock tower atop the Borough Hall; it was destroyed by fire.

About 1900

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

(2)

The Borough Hall, many years later. The clock tower has been restored.

1936

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project

Fulton Street, west side, near Myrtle Avenue. Shown are two views of the cupola of Brooklyn's Borough Hall, as rebuilt after the fire of 1858.

1920's
Views 1, 2

Fulton Street, west side, near Myrtle Avenue. Shown are two views of the cupola of Brooklyn's Borough Hall, as rebuilt after the fire of 1858.

1920's
Views 1, 2

Court Street, south from the intersection of Fulton and Court Streets. Also shown at the left, is Fulton Street, south from and including Court, to and including Joralemon Streets. In the foreground, is shown the Borough Hall Station of the B. M. T. and I. R. T. Subway Lines. In the background, is shown the Borough Hall Building.

December 1925.

Brown Brothers.

Fulton Street, west side, from Myrtle Ave., to Joralemon Street, as seen from Borough Hall Park. In the center is the Fulton Street Elevated line.

April 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Fulton Street, south from, but not including Myrtle Ave., to and including Joralemon Street. On the left is shown the Court Street Station of the Fulton Street B.M.T. Elevated Lines. On the right, in the extreme background, on Joralemon Street, is seen the Kings County Supreme Court Building. On the right on the street level, is the Court Street Station of the Fourth Ave., B.M.T. Subway Line. 1928.
Hall-Photo.

Court Street, east side, just south of the intersection of Fulton and Court Streets. A view of Borough Hall Park, and Borough Hall Building.

1933.

Ewing Galloway.

Fulton Street (elevated structure thereon), west side, at Myrtle Avenue (foreground), showing prominently the Mechanics Bank Bldg. The partially seen building at the left is the Montague Court Building.

September 7, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

Fulton Street (right), west side, at Myrtle Avenue. The old 3-story building is at the southeast corner of the intersection and the clearance at the northeast corner. The Fulton Street "EL" is on the right and in the background is the dome of the Borough Hall.

P. L. Sperr
September 7, 1938

title: Henry Ward Beecher Statue, Court, Fulton, and Washington Streets
